ch.aplu.android

Class GGStatusBar

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.aplu.android.GGStatusBar

  • public class GGStatusBar
extends java.lang.Object
    Class to provide space for one line of text shown in a game grid window normally used for displaying status information. The status bar is attached at the bottom of the game grid window, but a freely floating bar is also available. A GGStatusBar reference is returned by calling addStatusBar() in the GameGrid constructor.

    • Method Detail

      • getTextWidth

        public int getTextWidth()
        Returns the width of last text given by setText().
        Returns:
        the text widht in pixel; 0 of no text was yet set

      • getTextHeight

        public int getTextHeight()
        Returns the text height attribute. The text height is 0.7 * height of the status bar passed in createStatusBar().
        Returns:
        the value of the text height attribute

      • getBackgroundColor

        public int getBackgroundColor()
        Returns the background color attribute (default: Color.rgb(90, 90, 90)).
        Returns:
        the background color

      • setBackgroundColor

        public GGStatusBar setBackgroundColor(int color)
        Sets the background color attribute. The new value is used the next time a text is displayed.
        Parameters:
        color - the new background color
        Returns:
        the GGStatusBar reference to allow chaining

      • setRefreshEnabled

        public GGStatusBar setRefreshEnabled(boolean enable)
        Enables/disables the the automatic refresh by calling GameGrid.refresh() is called at the end of setText(). Be aware that this may cause flickering because different threads are refreshing the game grid.
        Parameters:
        enable - if true, the automatic refresh attribute is set to true; otherwise it is set to false
        Returns:
        the GGStatusBar reference to allow chaining

      • setText

        public GGStatusBar setText(java.lang.String text,
                  int backgroundColor)
        Same as setText(String text), but sets the background color attribute to given color.
        Parameters:
        text - the text to show in the status bar
        backgroundColor - the new background color
        Returns:
        the GGStatusBar reference to allow chaining

      • setText

        public GGStatusBar setText(java.lang.String text)
        Sets the given text in the status bar. To make the text visible, the GameGrid must be refreshed either by calling refresh() or by the running game thread. If the automatic refresh attribute is set by calling setRefreshEnable(true), the game grid is automatically refreshed at the end of setText(). Be aware that this may cause flickering because different threads are refreshing the game grid.
        Parameters:
        text - the text to show in the status bar
        Returns:
        the GGStatusBar reference to allow chaining
